area_name: Unsorted Boulders To Be Placed In Their Appropriate Subareas

content.description: Start at an undercling and continue a bit left following the flaky jugs to the top out. A great warm up with sharp jugs.
content.location: Can be found by following the main trial straight until an obvious fork in the road, bearing left, and following the trail for a little while. It is up the hill a bit from the trail.

content.description: Start on good, chalked-up jugs, traverse left, fire up to the  crown, get a high left foot and press through for the topout.
content.location: in the upper section, left of Blaire Witch and Mercury

content.description: Cool moves around an overhanging bulge
content.location: far left side of the first sector off of the carriage road

content.description: use the cracks to the left to pull your feet into the boulder while leaning out towards the tree, then a little past half way, there are some bad slopers and they get progressively better but still not good the higher you go
content.location: at the first fork in the path coming from the parking area, go down the right side, and when the path starts turning right, turn left, there is a trail of various boulders going up the hill. this one is directly next to a tree and has multiple nearly vertical cracks. way down is around the back. the top is big and flat, nice for resting and sprawling out

content.description: Start matched on the heavily chalked, obvious rail 5 feet up. The problem goes up and to the left; all the holds are well chalked and pretty obvious (mostly jugs).(Note: There is a sit-start on two crimps below the starting rail for this problem that’s a couple grades harder, but I can’t find mention of it anywhere and I didn't do it myself. I don’t think the name of that one is different, though evidently there is a harder start starting somewhere down and to the left called Pebble Pusher.)
content.protection: Pad or two if you want
content.location: Located on a large boulder just up the hill behind the boulder containing Diesel/Official/Premium etc, about 30 feet from that one (but you have to go around a big pile of boulders to see it). Good quick warmup for those.Coordinates: 41.454680, -73.616607

content.description: Great warmup with a pretty good number of moves on solid jugs. Start the same as Flex Traverse, but instead of moving up to the lip and topping out at the apex, keep moving left another 6 feet along the obvious crack. When the chalk runs out in the crack, top out (a couple feet before the top lip curves away).
content.protection: Landing is suboptimal, but you’re always on jugs so theoretically any fall should be very controllable.
content.location: First big boulder you hit as you head up the hill on the left trail. See description/photos for Flex Traverse.

content.description: Great warmup for the upper section, and the first thing you come across as you get to the top of the hill. No idea how this isn’t already on here somewhere, it’s heavily chalked and clearly a great first problem to do.  Start matched on the obvious jug and use the right heel to move up and left. Top out on the big jug right at the apex.
content.location: It’s the obvious jug line up the right arete of the boulder, below the big rock with the red and white graffiti on it. If you make the left after walking in from the parking and go up the hill, you’ll literally walk smack into it.

content.description:
Climb starts matched on the dish on the right side of the boulder.  Works left on this boulder to where it meets a larger structure of rock.  Anything that doesn't include the entrée boulder and the large rock face behind it is off (not that it would be much use).  Cool use of heel hooking, some long moves with short beta options, and a sloped out top out. 

  A video from the when I put it up... Beta Warning....  Also, I was thinking V5 before, but I think I'm thinking V4 now... FA just seemed harder I guess.

Entée Video
content.protection: 1 pad is appropriate.  Landing is a slight grade.
content.location: Off the right side of the trail behind the barrel boulder just past the upper stone wall.  Check out the area map I made for detail.

content.description: Start same as Catharsis but once you hit the Howl start, move left to the sidepull rail and go up.  Contrived and a little sharp but still worthwhile.  Area testpiece!

Classic crimpy compression on a horizontal refrigerator bloc with a semi-sketchy block ledge landing 3 ft off the ground. Get some pads and spotters and come get this one! Starts on the fin in the very inside of the boulder and compresses all the way along the long way of the roof, topping out at the very end of the boulder. The wall to the left of the boulder is off and makes starting a bit tricky.
content.location: On the same boulder as the official, but walk to the right around the boulder of the official by 20ish feet and you should see it.

content.description: I haven‘t found any info about this boulder, so adding it. Start low on sharp left facing hold. Move through middle, and set up to throw to obvious jug. Easy top out to left.
content.location: Boulder located near the area “sloper city” in the very descriptive map you undoubtedly have. When looking uphill at it, it looks like a shark head coming out the ground. Pond is at climbers back/right.

content.description: Start matched on wide jug halfway up the east face of ice cube, feet wide on two good holds on either side of you. reach up to a sloper on the upper right. top out to the left.
content.location: east face of ice cube. to the right of mono problem.

content.description: Starts on a flake all the way right of the Finish Jug on Fake Snakes. Goes into that Jug then the normal top out of Fake Snakes. Separated Boulder is off.

pathTokens: Unsorted Boulders To Be Placed In Their Appropriate Subareas

content.description: The upper boulder area, home to the Mercury, Blair Witch, and Deep Woods blocs.
